3274080.name: CVE-2009-5155 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3274080.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

3274089.name: CVE-2009-5155 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3274089.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

3279725.name: CVE-2013-4235 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3279725.description: shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

3279730.name: CVE-2013-4235 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3279730.description: shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

3292173.name: CVE-2015-8985 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3292173.description: The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.

3292180.name: CVE-2015-8985 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3292180.description: The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.

3297393.name: CVE-2016-10228 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3297393.description: The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

3297399.name: CVE-2016-10228 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3297399.description: The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

3298659.name: CVE-2016-10739 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3298659.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

3298665.name: CVE-2016-10739 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3298665.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

3300360.name: CVE-2016-2781 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3300360.description: chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

3327897.name: CVE-2017-11164 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3327897.description: In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression.

3385190.name: CVE-2017-18018 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3385190.description: In GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX "-R -L" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition.

3436794.name: CVE-2018-1000654 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3436794.description: GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file.

3462145.name: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3462145.description: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

3462510.name: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3462510.description: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

3462655.name: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

3479341.name: CVE-2018-16868 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3479341.description: A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

3479351.name: CVE-2018-16869 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3479351.description: A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

3479359.name: CVE-2018-16869 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3479359.description: A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

3488101.name: CVE-2018-19211 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3488101.description: In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

3488105.name: CVE-2018-19211 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3488105.description: In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

3488109.name: CVE-2018-19211 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

3488127.name: CVE-2018-19211 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

3488132.name: CVE-2018-19211 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3488132.description: In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

3498722.name: CVE-2018-20839 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3498722.description: systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

3498731.name: CVE-2018-20839 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3498731.description: systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

3530969.name: CVE-2018-7169 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3530969.description: An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

3530974.name: CVE-2018-7169 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3530974.description: An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

3554485.name: CVE-2019-12904 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3554485.description: ** DISPUTED ** In Libgcrypt 1.8.4, the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.) NOTE: the vendor's position is that the issue report cannot be validated because there is no description of an attack.

3555029.name: CVE-2019-13050 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3555029.description: Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKS keyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPG keyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyserver network. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial of service, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack.

3569224.name: CVE-2019-15847 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3569224.description: The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same.

3585204.name: CVE-2019-17543 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3585204.description: LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

3585721.name: CVE-2019-17594 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3585721.description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the _nc_find_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

3585810.description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

3585836.name: CVE-2019-17595 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3585836.description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

3585841.name: CVE-2019-17595 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3585841.description: There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the fmt_entry function in tinfo/comp_hash.c in the terminfo library in ncurses before 6.1-20191012.

3586266.name: CVE-2019-18276 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3586266.description: An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected.

3604586.name: CVE-2019-20838 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3604586.description: libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454.

3606531.name: CVE-2019-25013 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3606531.description: The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read.

3606535.name: CVE-2019-25013 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3606535.description: The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read.

3668882.name: CVE-2020-13844 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3668882.description: Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."

3669132.name: CVE-2020-13844 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3669132.description: Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."

3669256.name: CVE-2020-13844 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3669256.description: Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."

3674996.name: CVE-2020-14155 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3674996.description: libpcre in PCRE before 8.44 allows an integer overflow via a large number after a (?C substring.

3718639.name: CVE-2020-27618 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3718639.description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.

3718644.name: CVE-2020-27618 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3718644.description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.

3743984.name: CVE-2020-6096 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3743984.description: An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.

3743988.name: CVE-2020-6096 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3743988.description: An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.

3764099.name: CVE-2021-24031 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3764099.description: zstd adds read permissions to files while being compressed or uncompressed

3764106.name: CVE-2021-24032 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3764106.description: Race condition allows attacker to access world-readable destination file

3767782.name: CVE-2021-27645 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3767782.description: The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c.

3767786.name: CVE-2021-27645 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
3767786.description: The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c.

3768748.name: CVE-2021-3326 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3768748.description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

3768752.name: CVE-2021-3326 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3768752.description: The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

3864825.name: CVE-2018-20796 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3864825.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

3864828.name: CVE-2018-20796 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3864828.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

3883441.name: CVE-2019-1010022 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3883441.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

3883444.name: CVE-2019-1010022 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3883444.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

3883480.name: CVE-2019-1010023 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3883480.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

3883482.name: CVE-2019-1010023 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3883482.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

3883519.name: CVE-2019-1010024 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3883519.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

3883523.name: CVE-2019-1010024 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3883523.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

3932460.name: CVE-2019-6488 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3932460.description: The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy.

3932462.name: CVE-2019-6488 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3932462.description: The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy.

3932881.name: CVE-2019-7309 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3932881.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

3932882.name: CVE-2019-7309 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
3932882.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

3936844.name: CVE-2019-9619 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3936844.description: ** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: none. Reason: This candidate was withdrawn by its CNA. Further investigation showed that it was not a security issue. Notes: none.

3952947.name: CVE-2020-13776 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
3952947.description: systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.
